cards.front: What are Newton's three laws of motion?
cards.back:
1. An object at rest stays at rest and an object in motion stays in motion with the same speed and direction unless acted upon by an unbalanced force.
2. The acceleration of an object is directly proportional to the net force acting on it and inversely proportional to its mass.
3. For every action, there is an equal and opposite reaction.

questions.stem: Which of the following Newton's laws states that every action has an equal and opposite reaction?
options: Law 1: An object at rest tends to stay at rest.
Law 2: The acceleration of an object is directly proportional to the net force acting on it.
Law 3: For every action, there is an equal and opposite reaction.
Law 4: Gravitational forces act between all masses proportionally to their product.
questions.rationale: The statement 'For every action, there is an equal and opposite reaction' describes the third law of motion.

insights.title: Newton's Laws of Motion Insight
insights.takeaway: Newton's First Law (Law of Inertia) states that an object at rest will stay at rest, and an object in motion will stay in motion with the same speed and direction unless acted upon by an external force. Newton's Second Law (F=ma) relates the acceleration of an object to the net force acting on it, and its mass. Newton's Third Law (Action-Reaction Principle) states that for every action, there is an equal and opposite reaction.
